name: ext_R4_Expression
title: Cross-version Extension for R4.Expression for use in FHIR R2
description: This cross-version extension represents Expression from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Expression|4.0.1 for use in FHIR R2.

element.short: An expression that can be used to generate a value
element.definition: A expression that is evaluated in a specified context and returns a value. The context of use of the expression must specify the context in which the expression is evaluated, and how the result of the expression is used.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.short: Natural language description of the condition
element.definition: A brief, natural language description of the condition that effectively communicates the intended semantics.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition should be version specific.  This will ideally be the URI for the Resource Profile defining the extension, with the code for the extension after a #.

element.short: Short name assigned to expression for reuse
element.definition: A short name assigned to the expression to allow for multiple reuse of the expression in the context where it is defined.
